bibl.title: The Threshold Papyri from Karanis.
Karanis Revealed. Discovering the Past and Present of a Michigan Excavation in Egypt

bibl.note: Papyri found in a wooden threshold which belonged to the manager of Karanis's grapheion in the early 2nd century AD. P. Mich. VII, 430 = C.P.L. 45 (= M.-P.3 3023; LDAB 4480) appears on the recto of P. Mich. Inv. 4385 and 4390; P. XVe Congrès 15 on the recto of P. Mich. Inv. 4385.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Mich. Inv. 4382-4388 verso ined.; 4390-4391 verso ined. 145.4 P. XVe Congrès 15
W. Graham Claytor, The Threshold Papyri from Karanis.

Terry G. Wilfong (ed.), with the assistance of Andrew W.S. Ferrara, Karanis Revealed. Discovering the Past and Present of a Michigan Excavation in Egypt = Kelsey Museum Publication 7 (Ann Arbor, 2014) pp. 161-164, 1 tabl., figg. 56-57.

Papyri found in a wooden threshold which belonged to the manager of Karanis's grapheion in the early 2nd century AD. P. Mich. VII, 430 = C.P.L. 45 (= M.-P.3 3023; LDAB 4480) appears on the recto of P. Mich. Inv. 4385 and 4390; P. XVe Congrès 15 on the recto of P. Mich. Inv. 4385.
